intro: Ferula latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved ferula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and aromatic foliage. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and its leaves are broad and often have a pungent scent. Ferula latiloba is known for its medicinal properties, with its roots and leaves used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
